com. mab. util. debug

Description

Debug without the Flash IDE.

Usage

import com.mab.util.debug;
debug.setColor(0x0000FF);
debug.trace("Hello World!");
debug.clear();

Version

2.0

Author

Michael Bianco, http://developer.mabwebdesign.com/

Date

06/01/05

Summary
com. mab. util. debug
Debug without the Flash IDE.
Variables
txtRef
Reference to the text field used for displaying trace()’s
count
How many trace() calls have been made, used for determining when to call clear()
maxResults
The max amount of lines that will fit on the screen
socket
If initSocket() was called, socket represents the XMLSocket connection to a ‘trace server’
connected
Bool representing if the socket is currently connected to a ‘trace server’
useMtascMethodTrace
Bool.
useMtascFileTrace
Bool.
waitForSocketConnection
Bool.
disableTracing
Bool.
msgStack
connected
useMtascMethodTrace
useMtascFileTrace
waitForSocketConnection
disableTracing
quiet
Functions
trace
Send output to the debug text field
dumpObject
initDebugField
creates & inializes the debug text field
setColor
sets the color of the text in the debug field
clear
clears the text that is currently in the text field
initSocket
Initalizes a socket connection to send trace() input to.
_clearMsgStack
Clears the msgStack if there is one.

Variables

txtRef

static private var txtRef: TextField

Reference to the text field used for displaying trace()’s

count

static private var count: Number

How many trace() calls have been made, used for determining when to call clear()

maxResults

static private var maxResults: Number

The max amount of lines that will fit on the screen

socket

static private var socket: XMLSocket

If initSocket() was called, socket represents the XMLSocket connection to a ‘trace server’

connected

Bool representing if the socket is currently connected to a ‘trace server’

useMtascMethodTrace

Bool.  If it is true the MTASC method trace string is prepended to str

useMtascFileTrace

Bool.  When true prepends MTASC’s file data (file name and line #) to the trace str

waitForSocketConnection

Bool.  When true and you are trying to connect to a scoket

disableTracing

Bool.  When true the debug.trace() funtion will not trace any data

msgStack

static private var msgStack: Array

connected

static public var connected: Boolean

useMtascMethodTrace

static public var useMtascMethodTrace: Boolean

useMtascFileTrace

static public var useMtascFileTrace: Boolean

waitForSocketConnection

static public var waitForSocketConnection: Boolean

disableTracing

static public var disableTracing: Boolean

quiet

static public var quiet: Boolean

Functions

trace

static function trace(str):Void

Send output to the debug text field

Parameters

stra string to send to the debugger text field

dumpObject

public static function dumpObject(ob: Object)

initDebugField

static function initDebugField(Void):Void

creates & inializes the debug text field

setColor

static function setColor(c):Void

sets the color of the text in the debug field

Parameters

cThe color to set the textfield to

clear

static public function clear(Void):Void

clears the text that is currently in the text field

initSocket

static public function initSocket(h,
p):Boolean

Initalizes a socket connection to send trace() input to.  If the connection succeeds all output is sent to the socket server instead of the textfield

Parameters

hString specifing a specific host to connect to.  If this argument is not specified “localhost” is used
pNumber specifing the port to connect to on the host.  If this argument is not specified ----

Returns

Boolean; Return value from XMLSocket.connect, if this function returns true it actually doesn’t mean you’ve successfully connected with the server

_clearMsgStack

static public function _clearMsgStack(Void):Void

Clears the msgStack if there is one.  This is called from the sockets onConnect event, and should not be called anywhere else.
